summary:
Skilled Treasurer with extensive experience in Start-up and Scale-up Treasury departments. Skills include TMS, Payments, Cash Flow Forecasting, strategic goal setting, Trade Credit and Cash Management. Strong Treasury leader with a Post Graduate focused in Treasury Management from Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. 

I'm characterized as equal parts a Thinker and Do-er, engaging in white boarding- strategies and problem-solving with a strong motivation to get things done. 

•Proven expertise in rolling out new markets and business models, restructuring and green-field deployment of Treasury organizations (20+ new markets) in EMEA and APAC

•Strong communication skills, ability to communicate complex concepts and ideas in a simple manner and influence stakeholders across the organization;  strong empathy and natural feeling for 'selling the message'.

•I engage with Stakeholders in partnerships by educating and evidencing working treasury concepts whilst taking stakeholder interests into account. I have a strong feeling for P2P/ O2C, Tax, Accounting and Legal aspects in Treasury.  I see the (operational) business as my clients.

•I'm comfortable in dynamic working environments delivering results within tight timelines and complex environments. I am a self-starter positioning myself as a leader and team-player with a collaborative approach. I lead teams by supporting, coaching and knowledge-sharing.

• Excellent command of English and Dutch; both written and spoken. Good working knowledge in Spanish and German and basic knowledge in French.

treasury_media.title: SEPA Benefits and opportunities ready to be unlocked by stakeholders
treasury_media.description: With Single Euro Payments Area (SEPA) deadline of 1 February 2014 rapidly approaching, the European Commission DG Internal Market and Services asked PwC to estimate the ongoing benefits of SEPA âonce fully embracedâ. This report summarises the findings and includes the perspectives and feedback of the stakeholder representatives we interviewed in November and December, 2013. It also describes the assumptions underlying our calculations and the limitations of the model used for this study.

treasury_media.title: Preparing for SEPA
treasury_media.description: The Single Euro Payments Area (SEPA) is the EU's payments integration project. Its aim is to develop a set of harmonised payment schemes and frameworks for electronic euro payments The compliance deadline is 1 February 2014 - just four months away!

treasury_media.title: 201309 TMI Magazine- SEPA Deadline- actions to take now
treasury_media.description: In this article we discuss potential shortcuts and Backup plans for SEPA compliancy.

treasury_media.title: SEPA readiness thermometer - August 2013 update
treasury_media.description: Co-author of the August 2013 update of the PwC SEPA readiness Thermometer.

treasury_media.title: SEPA - Het laatstje stuke van de eenwording van de europese betaalmarkt

education.degree_name: Post Graduate- Register Treasurer (comparable with CTP)

school.name: HU University of Applied Sciences Utrecht (Hogeschool Utrecht)

projects.title: Inhouse-Bank assessment & Business Case for a Large Real Estate Investment Manager
projects.description:
The client asked PwC to assess its current IT landscape and Processes related to In-house-banking and it’s Payment Factory. The project included building a Future state IT landscape including Level 1&2 process maps as well as a system suitability assessment. 

My role in this covered the Project Management and delivering Subject Matter Expertise.

projects.title: In-house-Bank/ Payment Factory Business case for a leader in the Telecom/ Media Sector
projects.description:
The project covered a full business case assessment on the benefits and cost drivers of the group wide In-house Bank. It included a detailed analysis on a multitude of countries and business case drivers. 

My role in this project covered the full assessment and project management of the project.

projects.title: Asset Quality Review on Financial Restructuring and Recovery
projects.description:
Review of Financial Restructuring and Recovery (bijzonder beheer) files.
Validating policy compliance at a Large Bank.

projects.title: SEPA Back up Scenario
projects.description:
Due to delays in IT readiness on SEPA the client required to formulate a Back up plan including the selection of a Payment services Provider. 

Included : RfP, beauty parade's and selection

projects.title: SEPA Subject Matter Expert and Quality Assurance
projects.description:
Client:  Utilities Company

The project covered a wide range of specialism such as IT, AR/AP, Legal and Public Relations. The client was highly dependent on an external service provider (Joint Venture) and was key stakeholder in the project of this external party. The company is highly dependent on direct debits and faced challenges on the SEPA readiness of IT systems. The project covered some outsourcing of SEPA activities. 

I joined project group and SteerCo meetings as Subject Matter Expert and reviewed project documentation.

projects.title: Internal Audit Support on a Treasury & Cash Management audit
projects.description:
I joined the client’s internal audit team during two audits of the Treasury activities of daughter companies.
I brought specific Treasury and Cash Management knowledge to the team which allowed the team to deepen the investigation. The audits were performed at the Treasury department of Real Estate Bank and a Fund Manager.

projects.title: SEPA Implementation
projects.description:
Client: Real Estate Asset Manager (Germany)

After the Impact Assessment phase we have been asked to join the SEPA project as Subject Matter Experts. My role is to create a blueprint of the current business requirements related to (international) payments and migrate these to SEPA compliant business requirements. Other tasks are advising on communication strategies, IT strategy and project planning. The challenges in the project are: heterogeneous IT environment, wide geographical spread, broad reliance on external parties and a heavy user of Direct Debits.

projects.title: Payment Services Directive II ( PSD II)/ Access to Account (XS2A)  Impact study for a Large Dutch Bank
projects.description: The revisit of the Payment Services Directive introduces several potential disruptive events in the world of Payments. The bank hired PwC to perform an Impact analysis and advice on how to position the bank towards this directive. Several spin-off projects have been formulated from this impact study.

projects.title: Re-alignment Vision on Transaction Banking
projects.description:
Resulting from several years of developments in the area of Payments and Transactions the bank required re-alignment of their vision of Transaction Banking. 

We performed an extensive analysis on the new developments in the world of Cash Management, Payments and Transactions and assessed (both corporate and retail) clients needs. The report resulting in re-aligned of the bank wide vision on Transaction banking and has been the starting point for many new projects in the bank.

projects.title: Creation of a bank-wide vision on Transaction Banking
projects.description:
PwC has been engaged to assist in the creation of a bank-wide vision on Transaction Banking. 

The team has performed a study on the external environment with respect to Transaction Banking.  Based on the findings of both the internal and external developments a vision was created to position the bank to respond to the changes in the TB landscape.  Our role was to perform the study, assist in drafting the vision and to prepare the strategy for positioning the bank to respond accordingly.

projects.title: SEPA Quality Assurance
projects.description:
I have been involved as Subject Matter Expert on SEPA in audits for over 30 public and private organisations operating in various sectors. 

Key words: Quality Assurance, SEPA advice, Subject Matter Expertise

projects.title: SEPA Subject Matter Expert and Quality Assurance
projects.description: The project covered a multi background project team (including AP/AR, IT, , Legal, Communications and Accounting) at a Shared Service Center. The client operated a heterogeneous IT landscape and carried a wide range of products. The client is a heavy direct debit user and has to rely on external parties for some part of the master data management.  I have been involved from the Impact Assessment stage throughout the Implementation stage and have supported the client on Project Management, Quality Assurance and Subject Matter Expert. My activities covered: review of project documentation, advising on methodology and solving ad hoc issues.

projects.title: SEPA Impact Assessment
projects.description:
Client: Real Estate Asset manager (Germany)

The goal of this project was to investigate the impact of SEPA on the organization and formulate a Project plan for implementing SEPA. The methodology included interviews with all stakeholders and reviewing processes and procedures linked to payments. The scope of the engagement covered several business units and the corporate level. Our deliverable was a detailed description of the organization with the SEPA pain points identified and quantified. We also delivered a detailed project plan and budget estimates for the project.

contributors.headline: Executive Interim Manager, Chief Restructuring Officer, Chief Integration Officer

projects.title: SEPA Impact Assessment
projects.description:
Client: local Municipality

The project included a workshop with the group of stakeholders. The Impact Analysis has been performed by means of interviews with key stakeholders, procedure checks and IT landscape mapping.

contributors.headline: Certified Independent FIS Integrity Consultant at Global clients (10y+ experience in Integrity)

projects.title: Bank selection for Cash Management infrastructure
projects.description:
Due to a carve-out the company had a need to re-assess their Cash Management and Financial Logistics solution. We assisted the client in mapping its bank/ IT landscape, required bank account structure and Cash Pool setup prior to drafting the Request for Proposal (RfP). The RfP was sent out to the key Cash Management banks in the Netherlands. The scope covered the payments infrastructure, investment products and cash pool structure.

Our approach: Assess As-is situation, design To-be, Draft RfP and Assess based on balanced scorecards. 

Client: Real Estate Investment Manager

contributors.headline: Combining financial expertise with my passion for sports @ NIKE Treasury
CFO at Heuschen & Schrouff Oriental Food

projects.title: Valuation Methodology validation
projects.description:
Client: Mayor Pension fund Asset Manager

Due to the implementation of a new TMS system the client required an analysis and validation of the systems embedded valuation methodologies.

The approach: Validation based on common market practise and theoretical framework.

contributors.headline: Senior Controller, Control Rabobank Group at Rabobank

projects.title: Treasury Management System Selection
projects.description:
Client: Debt Management Office

Due to the upgrade of Wall Street Suite (Finance Kit) to version 7.0 the client was forced to re-implement the TMS. The client asked us to assess the suitability of Wall Street Suite 7.X versus the other TMS in the market for their needs. Based on the client’s needs we carried out this assessment during a 2 month project. The project approach was based on workshops, expert opinions and balance score cards.

profile_positions.description:
Regional Treasury leader for EMEA and APAC (ex. china) and Global Treasury Settlement Center
50+ entities over 32+ countries over $ 20B of annual revenue 
Treasury lead in M&A projects
Design and implementation of Regional/Global Cash Management infrastructure 
Financial Risk Management 
Intercompany settlements and lending 
Trade guarantees Debt Facilities
Responsible for new markets  set up (20+ in EMEA &APAC)
Responsible for compliance and controls (i.e. SOX)
Design of Global Treasury center 
Global leader of TMS implementation project (including IHB)
profile_positions.title: EMEA Treasurer

profile_positions.description:
Corporate Treasury advices Corporates (incl. public sector) and Financial Institutions on all aspects of Treasury, covering Strategy & Policy, Cash & Liquidity Management, Treasury Management Systems, Risk Management and Treasury Control. Within this team Emiel has specialized in Cash & Liquidity Management. 

Within the topic of Cash & Liquidity Management he has extensive experience in Payments & Financial Logistics, Payment & Collection factories, Bank Selections, Cash Pool solutions, Cash Flow forecasting and Working Capital. The topic of Cash& Liquidity Management is currently at the top of the agenda of the Treasurer due to the impact of regulatory topics such as SEPA and Basel, which have or will change bank infrastructure significantly. Emiel is a strong believer that this is the time to assess Corporate Bank landscape to benefit from all the advantages that can be achieved by restructuring the Bank infrastructure.

In addition to his work in Cash & Liquidity Management Emiel has been frequently involved in setting up or reviewing Treasury Strategy and Governance structures. Emiel often reviews Treasury Policies (incl. public sector) and has been involved in various Internal Audits on Treasury departments as Subject Matter Expert.
